tweet: I am not afraid of what I don’t know; I am afraid of what I think I know.  https://t.co/eg6BywcWJf

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: To address the rising tribalism in our nation, we must renew and rebuild institutions that connect us to one another and foster empathy. We can all be a part of that effort and join the Unify Colorado Challenge ( https://t.co/dItE5cUTfg)   https://t.co/B4kv3hYo0b

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: We need to appreciate how special #Jokic really is.   https://t.co/RvbdJAct04

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Practice constant vigilance and don't answer calls from numbers you don't recognize. We will continue to work hard to protect consumers from #robocalls.  And report scams to @StopFraudCo.   https://t.co/TqIaIlBNFm

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Read this article.  It’s a powerful testimonial by our Director and highlights why we need more honest conversations about mental health.

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Please sign up now.  The Unify Colorado Challenge will enable Coloradans from every corner of the state to talk about issues that matter most. Join us:  https://t.co/xEEHjnGSLX.  https://t.co/55XS9YmNwe

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: To call for more dialogue, former Republican Secretary of State Wayne Williams, @_UnifyAmerica_, and America Talks are sponsoring the Unify Colorado Challenge.  The core idea, as we explain to @Rossputin, is to support respectful civic dialogue.    https://t.co/CcP3ATo3qw

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: We need to condemn demonization and misinformation--and encourage dialogue, listening, and problem solving. That's what our Ginsburg/Scalia Initiative does, explaining that we can disagree with one another without becoming disagreeable.   https://t.co/hDQTXWezJl

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The misinformation and lawlessness that led to January 6th is not in the past.  There are even signs of it here in Colorado, with calls for violence and attacks on public officials.  We cannot sit idly by as this threat develops.  https://t.co/dLwiOKMokQ

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: We have too much division in our nation, too much demonization, and too little collaborative problem solving.  In Colorado, we can do something about it--learn more about the Unify Colorado Challenge ( https://t.co/xEEHjnGSLX.) and why it matters.  Thread 👇  https://t.co/VnmQaqf2B0

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Together, Colorado can make progress on this public health crisis.  In the years ahead, we will need continued data-driven conversations and collaboration between law enforcement, community leaders, public health professionals, and others.  I look forward to that work.

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: One critical form of action needs to be heightened awareness--that "one pill can kill" and that fentanyl can be in any substance.  As we have emphasized, parents need to talk to their kids about these risks.   https://t.co/WfAZJRh5F7

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The #opioid crisis is in a new stage with increased availability of fentanyl. The stories of those dying are a call to action.  https://t.co/fle5Bd1MLj

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: A bill just introduced is a valuable step in the right direction, with key public health measures and enhanced penalties for dealers who peddle fentanyl. The legislature should build on this bill, as I explain here.  https://t.co/xISxkcmJqR

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The legislature now has the opportunity to provide the appropriate tools and resources for law enforcement to go after those who distribute deadly fentanyl--often in disguised forms, such as a Xanax pill--and cause death, as @jasondunnco & I explained.  https://t.co/bHis4XpyMZ

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: We worked to develop regional collaboratives to address the opioid crisis--including rising fentanyl deaths--and build a framework that promises more treatment, recovery, education/awareness, and appropriate harm reduction opportunities.   https://t.co/MLNGf6GMxx

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The #opioid crisis started with prescription pills, pushed out by Purdue Pharma and others. Those actors are now being held accountable: Colorado is getting $400M and we are imposing limits on the distribution of such pills.  That's just the start.  https://t.co/4iZH7FKTaU

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: #fentanyl is deadly.   Here's what you need to know--in one graphic and a thread 👇  https://t.co/KWIDBjw2Je

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Fred Rogers' vision for our politics depends on empathy--and true listening.  That's core to servant leadership.  And that's hard because powerful forces in our society are seeking to undermine trust and brew contempt for others.   https://t.co/swG2o5OEdU

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: I am committed to defending the San Luis Valley and developing water management policies that protect our whole state.  That's what State Senator Cleave Simpson and I outlined in this op-ed.   https://t.co/d383LbUrUZ

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The San Luis Valley must be a tale of success, with the people of the SLV as the valley’s greatest strength. For that to happen, however, "water in the San Luis Valley needs to stay in the San Luis Valley.”  https://t.co/VsCQuM1X9x

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The San Luis Valley now struggles with depleted aquifers.  To address that, water managers are now working together to develop new, creative approaches to water management. That work is a testament to the Colorado spirit of collaborative problem solving.  https://t.co/SrrVicz4Mi

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: When I first visited the San Luis Valley as Attorney General, I called for a collaborative problem-solving mindset and not making decisions at the expense of some parts of our state.  I also promised the Valley that I would protect them.  https://t.co/SpO3lOZuWz

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Past efforts to engage in "wholesale buy and dry" plans against the wishes of communities undermined their local economies.  That happened in Crowley County.  We cannot let it happen to the San Luis Valley.   https://t.co/pQEHx99EFG

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: In Colorado, water is life. As Attorney General, I am committed to ensuring that we manage our water the right way. The plan to bring water from the San Luis Valley to Douglas County is just wrong.  Here's why (video and thread 👇)  https://t.co/J8tz5OrX0d

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Thanks, @matthewogray, for your leadership on a Colorado False Claims Act.  My testimony for this bill is here:   https://t.co/vAFg5slmVg  https://t.co/86I5PXXmYb

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: To address access to firearms by felons, we can pass HB 22-1257, an important bipartisan gun violence prevention measure. Thanks, @SoperMatthew, @SenBobGardner, @SenadoraJulie, and @mjweissman, for your leadership.

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: The rise in gun violence--used in 85% of homicides last year--highlights the need for responsible and effective gun safety measures, including our push for safe gun storage.   https://t.co/uWiSRQU9AF

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: Domestic violence deaths are up.  To save lives, we need responsible gun safety laws to remove firearms from domestic abusers who pose a deadly threat to their significant others and children.    https://t.co/jYUMqknnzl

name: Phil Weiser
tweet: According to the Denver Post, homicides are up in Aurora, Colorado Springs, and Denver.  There are important lessons for public policy  👇  https://t.co/qBDF3HVg4u
